text.p: These are the leading stories in the Turkish press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- EgyptAir Boeing 707 skids off the runway and hits taxi at Istanbul airport. Only 18 passengers were injured in the accident.
- Energy minister plans visit to Libya -- another country on the U.S. black list -- after recent visit to Iran which angered the United States.
- Conservative coalition partner True Path Party (DYP) concerned about losing its grassroots support to new party being formed by dissidents who quit the DYP.
- Energy minister says Turkey proposes equal sharing of water resources between Iraq, Syria and Turkey.
- Petroleum products prices rise by five percent.
- Islamist Prime Minister Necmettin Erbakan gearing up to support Islamic Movement Party in Kurdish-held northern Iraq.
- Alarm bells ringing for the thread industry as stock piles up.
- Erbakan says trade relations with Asia will increase after his ten-day tour there.
